result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert N. Askew was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g) [Modifiers: On or Near a Youth Center, Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submmit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  May Not have contact with known  felons, Fonte Foods, BP on 52nd St.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
** Pay prosecution costs of $440.00

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided).
** Pay DNA surcharge. May Not have contact with known felons, Fonte Foods, BP store on 52nd St.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Presentence incarceration credit.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney P Cafferty.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 1 & 2 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads guilty to cts 3 & 4.  Court finds deft guilty of cts 3 & 4.  PSI waived.  On ct 3 the court imposes a total sentence of 10 years WSP concurrent to current sentence in Racine 09CF876; 5 years initial confinement w/credit for 139 days served; 5 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for SAP and CIP; on ct 4 the court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 5 years w/conditions, consecutive to ct 3; pay prosecution costs of $440; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $500 DNA surcharge.
